name: Oatmeal chocolate chip waffles or oatmeal raisin waffles
description: Vegan Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Waffles are a great homemade sweet breakfast or brunch recipe you will love. You can even make them ahead for busy mornings and enjoy by just popping them in the toaster!
recipeIngredient: 1.5 cup non dairy milk (such as almond, soy, light coconut, or oat milk)
1/2 cup mini chocolate chips or raisins

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl combine flours, oats, coconut, baking powder, baking soda, and cinnamon. mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl combine flours, oats, coconut, baking powder, baking soda, and cinnamon. mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 1 cup of milk, maple syrup, and oil. Mix in until well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 1 cup of milk, maple syrup, and oil. Mix in until well combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Add milk 2 tbsp at a time until the mixture is not too stiff. Fold in the chocolate chips or raisins.
recipeInstructions.name: Add milk 2 tbsp at a time until the mixture is not too stiff. Fold in the chocolate chips or raisins.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat your waffle maker and cook the waffles according to the instructions based on your waffle maker.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat your waffle maker and cook the waffles according to the instructions based on your waffle maker.

recipeInstructions.text: The waffle mixture might get thick while sitting so add in more milk if needed. Serve with your favorite toppings such as maple syrup, vegan butter, berries, fruits etc.   Store: You can store these in the refrigerator for up to 5 days and freeze them for up to 2 months. When freezing, I would recommend you wrap the waffles individually in parchment and place them all in a large freezer bag.To reheat them, pop them in the toaster oven or the waffle maker.
recipeInstructions.name: The waffle mixture might get thick while sitting so add in more milk if needed. Serve with your favorite toppings such as maple syrup, vegan butter, berries, fruits etc.   Store: You can store these in the refrigerator for up to 5 days and freeze them for up to 2 months. When freezing, I would recommend you wrap the waffles individually in parchment and place them all in a large freezer bag.To reheat them, pop them in the toaster oven or the waffle maker.

keywords: chocolate chip waffles, oatmeal waffles, vegan waffles recipe
